imdb.title: Tetsuwan Bâdî Decode
imdb.plot: Birdy is an undercover, interstellar federation agent charged with capturing the most dangerous criminals in the galaxy. A famous model by day, Birdy spends her nights hunting deadly alien terrorists. When an innocent high school ...

episodes.title: After All
episodes.plot: When six deadly conspirators associated with the Ryunka attack escape from a satellite prison ship, Birdy is ordered to apprehend the fugitives before they wreak havoc on Earth.

episodes.title: Simple Twist of Fate
episodes.plot: In addition to continuing her search for the escaped terrorists, Birdy takes a bittersweet trip down memory lane with an old friend from her home planet.

episodes.title: Somewhere in Time
episodes.plot: Tsutomu and his friends interview two kids from the refugee camp, and Birdy bails out Nataru when his valiant rescue attempt goes painfully wrong.

episodes.title: Tears Are Not Enough
episodes.plot: Mr. Dusk's cooperation with Birdy's investigation garners him unwanted attention from the remaining fugitives. When the old man vanishes, Nataru goes looking for revenge.

episodes.title: Before It's Too Late
episodes.plot: The fugitives kidnap Irma as part of their plan to lure Birdy into a trap. When the federation agent is grazed by a blast from a powerful new weapon, her mind loses touch with its body!

episodes.title: A Prisoner of the Past
episodes.plot: In a desperate attempt to save Birdy from becoming permanently lost within the labyrinth of her own memories, Tsutomu delves into her consciousness on a psychic rescue mission.

episodes.title: We Will Meet Again
episodes.plot: Tsutomu's continued journey through Birdy's memory forces him to face the horrors of the Central Tower bombing - and Violin's agonizing final act of duty.

episodes.title: Falling in Love with Love
episodes.plot: Birdy and Nataru spend a day looking for a little girl who ran away from the hospital. Meanwhile, the terrorists have a theory about who's been hunting them, and they're out to settle the score.

episodes.title: Space, Time, and You
episodes.plot: The terrorists make repeated attempts on Nataru's life, but his unusual powers allow him to stay a step ahead of death. However, the very abilities keeping him alive - may also be destroying him.

episodes.title: It Never Entered My Mind
episodes.plot: Evidence suggests that Nataru is responsible for the terrorist murders, but Birdy refuses to arrest her old friend. Continued failure to fulfill her duty as a federation agent will only lead to more bloodshed.

episodes.title: Both Sides Now
episodes.plot: Nataru's violent rampage pushes his body to the point of collapse. Meanwhile, Valic turns himself in, but not before taunting Birdy with shocking details about the Central Tower bombing.

episodes.title: Before Long
episodes.plot: Birdy begs Nataru to stop his murderous quest for revenge, but he responds with a callous attack on his oldest friend. When Birdy is knocked unconscious, Tsutomu stands alone as the voice of reason.

episodes.title: Between You and Me
episodes.plot: Birdy uses her pin-up alter ego to help Tsutomu make a love connection with Sayaka, but everything goes horribly wrong when a Federation marionette is added to the equation!

episodes.title: One Plus One
episodes.plot: Birdy is a blazing hot Federation Agent charged with apprehending interplanetary scumbags, but tragedy strikes when an innocent boy gets caught in the middle of her cosmic crime-fighting.

episodes.title: The Partnered One
episodes.plot: Tsutomu isn't thrilled about living inside Birdy until his battered body is nursed back from the dead. Things get even worse when a last-minute photo shoot turns out to be an alien ambush!

episodes.title: View of Life
episodes.plot: When an icky alien rears its ugly head at recess, Tsutomu must tackle the interstellar menace in his own body if he wants to save the girl of his dreams.

episodes.title: A Stranger from Earth
episodes.plot: A visit to Birdy's home planet turns ugly when the curvy agent's tactical approach is called into question by the courts. Back on Earth, Shyamalan sets in motion a plan to unleash the Ryunka!

episodes.title: Another World
episodes.plot: Tsutomu's return to Earth is delayed when Birdy is ordered to investigate a terrorist attack on her home planet. Her mission: utilize her feminine charms to get close to the bad guys!

episodes.title: Both of Us
episodes.plot: Birdy's determination to recover the deadly Ryunka makes Tsutomu late to a pretty girl's party, but circumstances suggest they've been searching in all the wrong places.

episodes.title: Night Walker
episodes.plot: A haunting melody echoes through the darkness of the subway, luring unsuspecting girls to their mortal end. When Tsutomu's sister is targeted by the killer, Birdy goes undercover to crack the case.

episodes.title: Ghost Village
episodes.plot: Tsutomu and his friends take a summer road trip in search of abandoned buildings they can explore, but things get dangerous when Sayaka undergoes a startling transformation!

episodes.title: The Champion of Justice
episodes.plot: Birdy's fetish for soaking her beautiful body in the tub nearly exposes her true identity. Later, under cover of darkness, the intergalactic agent engages in a brutal catfight with deadly marionette.

episodes.title: You're the One
episodes.plot: Tsutomu's big date provides the perfect opportunity for Birdy to confirm her suspicions about the Ryunka's true identity. Meanwhile, Natsumi uncovers a startling secret concerning Shyamalan.

episodes.title: Bye Bye Buddy
episodes.plot: Determined to protect Sayaka, Tsutomu stands guard outside her home, but Birdy's crushing bombshell reveals bigger problems than simply finding the Chairman's killer.

episodes.title: Doomsday
episodes.plot: Shyamalan reveals the details of his sinister plan, and Tsutomu mounts a desperate final attempt to save Sayaka. Meanwhile, Birdy is given deadline to destroy the Ryunka.

episodes.title: Stand by Me
episodes.plot: Birdy learns of a method by which the Ryunka can be destroyed without terminating the life of its host; however, it requires someone willing to make the ultimate sacrifice.
